Tech News

FTC Said to Be Investigating YouTube Over Child Privacy Claims

The Federal Trade Commission is reportedly investigating YouTube’s handling of videos aimed at children.

The US Has Its Eye on Big Tech. Will Criminal Inquiries Result?

To date, large tech companies like Amazon, Apple, Facebook, and Google have been subjects of civil investigations by the U.S. government, but criminal investigations may be on the table as well.

Feds Lose Control of Thousands of Traveler Photos in Data Breach

Hackers reportedly stole thousands of traveler photos collected by a U.S. Customs and Border Protection subcontractor at a Canadian border crossing.

New SEC Lawsuit Could Decide the Fate of Dozens of Blockchain Projects

The Securities and Exchange Commission has filed a lawsuit against social media company Kik over its creation and sale of a cryptocurrency called Kin back in 2017, alleging that Kik should have filed disclosure forms required for conventional stock sales.

SEO News

Google Local Pack Finder Tests Choose Area Feature

Google is reportedly testing an option to let a searcher select a specific area by name to get local pack finder results.

Google Launches New Search Menu with Icons

Google has started rolling out a new search bar that includes both icons and text for search categories, news, video, images, maps, shopping, and other items.

Google Rolling Out Mobile Search Redesign with Black “Ad” Label, Favicons for Organic Results

Google is starting to release its mobile search redesign that features a black “Ad” label for paid results and displays favicons for organic results.

Google to Pre-Announce Future Core Search Algorithm Updates

In response to a question, Google’s Danny Sullivan said the company will likely pre-announce future updates to its core algorithm.

Google Responds to a WSJ Report That Concluded There Are Millions of Fake Business Listings on Maps

In response to an investigation by the Wall Street Journal finding that there are millions of fake business listings on Google Maps, Google issued a response on its blog describing what it does to combat the problem of fake listings.

The New Google My Business Features Giving Power Back to Local Businesses

Google My Business announced several new features that may help local businesses maximize the impact of their listings.

Legal Industry News

Legal Industry Adds 2,000 Jobs in May in Seesaw Employment Numbers

The legal profession gained back roughly as many jobs in May as it had lost in April, with the May numbers reflecting a year-over-year gain of 3,000 jobs.

Supreme Court Should End Nonunanimous Juries, ABA Argues in Amicus Brief

In a case on the Supreme Court’s fall 2019 docket, the ABA has submitted an amicus brief arguing that the Sixth Amendment right to a unanimous jury should be extended to the states.

Email Security Tips for Lawyers

Password security and firm-wide education around cyber crime are among the measures that attorneys can take to protect the highly sensitive data they are responsible for.

Lawyers Accused of Misconduct for Offensive, Inappropriate Emails About Colleagues, Minorities

Two attorneys associated with the Board of Veterans’ Appeals may face professional discipline for using their official government email accounts to send offensive messages regarding marginalized groups.

Social Media News

Everything You Need to Know About Google My Business Posts

Learn about the four kinds of Google My Business posts and how you can use them to help maximize your firm’s internet presence.

Facebook Launches Cryptocurrency With Visa, Mastercard, Uber, and Others

Facebook’s new cryptocurrency will be backed by a mixture of stable assets and traditional currencies, and the entity overseeing it will operate separately from Facebook.

LinkedIn Gets a Brand Refresh to Make it Feel “Warmer” and More Inviting

Two years in the making, the professional social network’s new look includes an updated logo, new color palette, and custom illustrations.

The 7 Biggest Social Media Sites in 2019

Events we Attended

CALIcon 2019

Justia sponsored and attended CALIcon19, held at the University of South Carolina School of Law. The conference brought together leading academics, educators, institutional leaders, and technology professionals to share ideas, innovations, experiences and best practices in legal education and technology.

Cornell LII’s Tom Bruce Retirement Celebration

One of Justia’s closest friends and allies, Tom Bruce, celebrated his retirement at the Fastcase offices in Washington, D.C. The co-founder and director of the Legal Information Institute of Cornell Law School, Tom has been at the helm of the LII since its inception in 1992, and he has been instrumental in the free law movement. A number of Justia folks attended his retirement party and gave him a warm send-off into the next chapter of his life.

Internet Stats

Online Reviews Stats

Getting online reviews can really boost your business. Consumers read online reviews to determine the quality of a local business. As you work with existing and new clients, thank them for their business and encourage them to post a review on your Google My Business listing.

Source: Forbes.com

Juris Pro Expert Witness Directory

JurisPro provides a free directory of expert witnesses in over 10,000 areas of expertise.

Law Enforcement Expert Witness Not Allowed to Testify in Excessive Force Case

Despite having been a consultant in over 1,700 cases, Plaintiff's Law Enforcement Expert Witness was not allowed to testify regarding legal questions.

U.S. District Court Allows Forensic Accounting Expert Witness to Testify Regarding Alleged Misappropriation of Trade Secrets

Plaintiff's Forensic Accounting Expert Witness was allowed to testify on alleged financial losses.

Testimony of Emergency Medicine Expert Witness is Limited

The court limited the testimony of defendant's Emergency Medicine Expert Witness to opinions regarding the alleged use of drug or alcohol.
